intro: Boehmeria paniculata, commonly known as Chinese hemp or wild flax, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces fibrous leaves and stems that are used in traditional medicine and textile production. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its fibrous material has been historically utilized for making rope and paper.
